intro: Julocroton humilis f. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf julocroton, is a compact shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It features small, ovate leaves with a broad, rounded shape, often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its foliage is evergreen, providing year-round visual interest in gardens. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained, sunny conditions.
